message: Some of our top priorities this legislative session include putting a stop to excessive regulations.

New year, new Congress. With Republicans controlling the House, Senate and now the White House, a unified Republican government will set an aggressive conservative agenda. It's time to make America great again.

We can’t continue to let outgoing presidential administrations, regardless of their political party, pass midnight rules that Congress can do little to nothing about. That's why I voted in favor of the Midnight Rules Relief Act of 2017. This bill would put in place a rapid-response method for Congress to undo last-minute rules from an outgoing administration.

Unelected bureaucrats in Washington have pushed through regulations that have damaging effects on hardworking Americans for far too long. Tonight I voted in favor of making sure they are held accountable. The American people deserve to have their voices heard.
I'm honored to represent the people of Missouri's 7th Congressional District again during the 115th Congress.

As Israel continues to be our strongest strategic, military and economic ally in the Middle East, the United States needs to remain on the right side of history and support our strongest ally. I believe that on January 20, 2017, when President-elect Donald Trump is sworn into office, Israel will finally have the friend and ally it deserves.
Thank you to all the brave men & women in southwest MO who put their lives on the line for their communities.

As the 115th Congress begins, I will continue to support legislation that strengthens our relationship with Israel. With a new Congress and a new administration, I am confident that Israel will once again see the United States as a strong ally it can count on.

Unelected Washington bureaucrats continue to push through regulations without weighing the costs. That's why I voted in favor of the SEC Regulator Accountability Act today. It strengthens the existing cost-benefit analysis system that is already in place, requires that the SEC explicitly explain how the new regulation would address the existing problem and would prohibit the SEC from issuing a rule that they are unable to show the benefits justifying the costs.

The national dialogue regarding law enforcement over the past few years has been disheartening. Officers have been talked about as if they are the problem rather than the solution. I refuse to accept this as the new normal. The time is now to support our law enforcement. I encourage everyone to let an officer know you care about them and that you appreciate what they do in often challenging circumstances. I will continue to voice my support for both local and state efforts that support our law enforcement as well as support legislation at the federal level that supports our law enforcement. It’s the right thing to do and I’m thankful for the opportunity to do so every day.

I made a promise to my constituents that I would repeal and replace this disastrous health care law and today I took one of the first steps to follow through on that promise. With premiums rising, Obamacare continues to let the American people down. It’s unacceptable and the American people deserve better. I look forward to supporting legislation that is patient-centered, allows for more choices and is at a much lower cost.
Can't wait to watch these talented young people perform at the inauguration!
It's time to make America great again! I can't wait to work with President Donald Trump and Vice President Mike Pence.

After 8 long years, we finally have a pro-energy president. Thanks to President Donald Trump, the Keystone pipeline and the Dakota Access pipeline will finally be built. This is a step in the right direction and I look forward to working with President Trump in the future on pro-energy legislation.

The American people agree, taxpayer money should not be funding abortions. I've always made it a priority to support legislation that saves lives and that’s why I voted in favor of H.R. 7. Someone needs to fight for those that can't fight for themselves.
I've been pro-life from day one and will continue to fight for those that can't fight for themselves.

The Midnight Rules Relief Act of 2017 and the REINS Act both create more accountability and ensure constituents have their voices heard. I’m confident that with the new administration and a unified Republican government, we will begin to weaken the federal government’s oppressive regulatory state on hardworking American taxpayers.

With southwest Missouri being a predominately rural district, I understand firsthand the challenges many students are facing when it comes to having access to high-speed services. U.S. Rep. Tony Cárdenas and I are teaming up to help close the rural broadband homework gap!

The American people deserve more choices and lower prices and Obamacare has failed to deliver.  "The reality is that 21 states have seen average premium increases of 25 percent or more. Seven states have seen increases of 50 percent or more. In 2016, there were 225 counties with just one insurer. This year, it is 1,022 counties with just one insurer. Five entire states just have one insurer offering coverage on the exchanges."

Taezia Caudle, from Springfield, Missouri, was diagnosed with Neurofibromatosis 1 at just 11 months old. One year into her clinical trial at The Children's Inn at NIH, Taezia's tumors have shrunk by 23 percent. It was an honor to get to meet her and her mother last week.

It’s time to stop playing partisan politics and realize that a majority of Americans agree that taxpayer money should not fund abortions. It’s never okay to be political when human lives are at stake.

Action needs to be taken on tax reform and I plan to continue to support legislation that will do just that. Our job in Washington isn’t to make Missourians’ lives harder, it’s to make them easier. Our broken tax code does not accomplish that and needs to be changed.

No state or taxpayer should be forced to fund health care services that perform abortions. States should be allowed to use Title X funds for health care providers that provide the best care for individuals. By forcing states to fund these health care facilities, money is being taken away from health care centers that offer a broader range of services. Something both men and women need access to.

A recent poll found that President Trump has significant support among Americans when it comes to his efforts to crack down on sanctuary cities. We live in a country of laws, and by not cracking down on sanctuary cities, we are promoting lawlessness that could American lives at risk.  "A majority — 52 percent — say they support Trump’s two executive orders allowing for the construction of a southern border wall, increasing the number of immigration officers by 10,000 and finding a way to revoke federal funds for sanctuary cities.  The crackdown on sanctuary cities is the most popular feature of those actions, followed closely by the directive to increase the border patrol, which is backed by 75 percent of voters."

Obamacare premiums continue to rise and choices continue to go down. The American people deserve better and that's why I look forward to supporting legislation that is patient-centered, allows for more choices and is at a much lower cost.
In case you missed it, last night I talked with KY3 about what I hope to hear from President Donald J. Trump at tonight's Joint Address.

Tonight’s speech from the President was both unifying and encouraging. After 8 years of overregulation, a weak national security and a failing health care system, I feel confident that the coming years will be much different. President Trump laid out an optimistic vision for the nation that will allow for a strong national security, quality education, a health care system that works and an economy that works for the people and not against.
Supreme Court nominee, Neil Gorsuch, is a champion of conservative values and the right person for the job.

Obamacare has failed the American people again and again. It's time to repeal and replace this law: http://ReadTheBill.GOP   The American Health Care Act will do the following:  → Lower costs and empower patients to make the right health care decisions for themselves and their families.  → Put power back in the hands of the states.  → Creates a Patient and State Stability Fund to help lower-income patients afford health care and repair states markets damaged by Obamacare.  → Protects patients with pre-existing conditions and allows young adults to stay on their parent’s insurance until age 26.  → Propose a per capita allotment to determine a fair level of funding for states based on the number of enrollees in each unique Medicaid population.
Congratulations to Walnut Grove's boys basketball team on winning its first-ever boys basketball state championship.
Congrats to Strafford High School's girls basketball team on a perfect season (33-0) and winning the Missouri Class 3 state championship!

I had a great meeting with the new University of Missouri System president, President Choi, today in my D.C. office. I’m confident that the UM System is in good hands and look forward to working with President Choi in the future.

I had a great time talking with local newspapers from Missouri's 7th Congressional District and members of the Missouri Press Association today in my D.C. office. I really appreciate the work that they do.

Our veterans deserve the best care available and by voting in favor of the VA Accountability First of 2017, it gets us one step closer to accomplishing that goal. It’s important that the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) be held accountable for their actions. By giving the VA Secretary more flexibility to remove, demote and suspend VA employees, it helps get rid of the bureaucratic red tape to ensure our veterans receive that care.

As day two of the SCOTUS hearing continues on nominee Judge Neil Gorsuch, I think it's an important reminder to remember that Mr. Gorsuch is a man who has consistently been respectful of the Constitution and its intended purpose. Mr. Gorsuch holds the same strong conservative values as the late Justice Antonin Scalia and would make an excellent Supreme Court Justice.
Happy National Agriculture Day to all the men and women in the agriculture industry that put food on our table and dedicate their lives to providing for others.

The American Health Care Act is the first step in reforming our health care system and untangling the mess that Obamacare has made. I look forward to continuing to work on this bill with my colleagues and getting the best possible deal for the American people.
Congratulations to the Springfield News-Leader on 150 years of excellence in journalism. I look forward to many more.
I enjoyed meeting with Fran Drescher, a cancer survivor, today in my Washington, D.C. office. As a father of a cancer survivor, I commend her dedication to the cause.
Happy Easter! Wishing you and your family a blessed day.

As Russia and Iran continue to prop up the Assad regime, it’s important the United States and its allies come together and stand against this regime’s behavior. The use of chemical weapons where terrorist organizations are operating is a threat to the entire international community, not just the United States.

Maycie Palmer, from Nixa High School, is this year's 2017 Congressional Art Competition winner from Missouri's Seventh Congressional District.   Maycie's winning selection is her colored pencil drawing entitled "Nostalgia." Her work will be displayed at the U.S. Capitol with other winning pieces from across the nation. She will have the opportunity to attend a ceremony in Washington, D.C., to unveil the winning work.   This year's second place winner is Nicolas Henderson, from Strafford High School, for his oil painting entitled "Farmers Market Still Life."  This year's third place winner is Julie Sharpe, from Central High School, for her oil painting entitled "Caught."  Thank you to all the students who participated in this year's competition. I continue to be impressed by the quality of work produced by students in our district.

One of my top priorities this legislative session is making sure that our veterans and their families are taken care of and receive the respect they deserve. That's why I will continue to meet with veterans and their families to address their needs. Whether that is through legislation or working with a governmental agency, I am ready to work on their behalf. After everything they and their families have done, it is the least I can do.

As more information continues to come in, my thoughts and prayers remain with the individuals who have been impacted by flooding in Missouri. My staff and I will continue to work with state and local officials to make sure that those affected by the flooding have the access to the resources they need. Please contact my Joplin and Springfield offices regarding any questions you might have.  Joplin District Office – 417.781.1041  Springfield District Office – 417.889.1800     Below is a list of online resources to help keep you updated:   Road Closures: http://bit.ly/1cekqID  Barry County: http://bit.ly/2qpLN1P Christian County: http://bit.ly/2qwj62r Greene County: http://bit.ly/1Sl4deb Jasper County: http://bit.ly/2qw9bdi  Lawrence County: http://bit.ly/2py5JPP  McDonald County: http://bit.ly/2oYwHOU  Newton County: http://bit.ly/2oPOcG2  Stone County: http://bit.ly/2oQacQT  Taney County: http://bit.ly/2pPuN8g

Today House Republicans made good on their promise to the American people and passed the American Health Care Act. With 84 percent of Missouri counties only having one option under the Obamacare exchanges, something had to change. I promised my constituents I would repeal and replace this disastrous law and today I made good on that promise. After seven long years of skyrocketing premiums, limited choices and government overreach, it’s time the American people decide what’s best for them instead of the government.

Yesterday during my manufacturing tour, I had the opportunity to visit CUSH CORP., NorthStar Battery, Tarsco Bolted Tank and Forged Waterjet Fabrications, LLC. These four businesses have a tremendous impact in southwest Missouri and I can't wait see what the future holds as each business continues to grow.

Using telehealth services allows for medical professionals to access rural and underserved areas that otherwise would not have access to quality care. In areas like those in Missouri’s 7th Congressional District, telehealth services are vital to making sure individuals receive the care they deserve and need.
Congratulations to the Strafford High School softball team on winning the Class 1 State Championship!

In 2017, it is unacceptable that students would be required to attend a school that can’t offer online access. Parents shouldn’t have to drive their kids to the nearest McDonalds or Starbucks to access Wi-Fi for class assignments. As technology continues to change, outdated laws need to be updated.
‪Today we honor and remember the brave men and women who gave the ultimate sacrifice to protect our freedoms.

For far too long newborns have lacked quality care that is imperative to their health. Each year thousands of newborns are admitted to a neonatal intensive care unit. This bill would help those children get the care they need and close the treatment gap that continues to grow with this age group. Parents have enough to worry about after having a child, and worrying about their child getting the necessary care they need and deserve shouldn’t be one of those things.

In late April devastating floods hit southwest Missouri destroying homes and damaging businesses. Today, President Trump signed off on a disaster declaration for Missouri that will provide federal assistance to individuals and families who were impacted. I would like to thank President Trump for supporting  the many Missourians affected by these floods as well Governor Greitens for his commitment to making sure all are taken care of.
Congratulations to the Missouri State baseball team on the big win tonight! Keep up the good work!
Today we remember and honor the brave U.S. troops who stormed the beaches of Normandy and the sacrifices they made. #DDay73

For far too long newborns have lacked the quality care that is crucial to their health. This is why I recently introduced the Promoting Life-Saving New Therapies for Neonates Act. This bill will close the treatment gap for newborns by incentivizing research for effective drugs and ensuring that these new drugs target the most critical needs of neonates. Parents have enough to worry about after having a child. They should not also have to worry about their child getting the care they need and deserve.

For the past two years, residents on Table Rock Lake have been burdened with bureaucratic red tape and unnecessary restrictions. After talking with those individuals and hearing their frustrations, Sen. Blunt and I teamed up last legislative session and introduced language in both the House and Senate that would address their concerns. After years of hard work, meetings and working with the Army Corps of Engineers, those individuals will finally have the opportunity to build and update their docks.
Happy 242nd Birthday, Army! Thank you for your service.

Hydropower is critical for an all-of-the-above approach to energy. Confronting the challenges of hydropower expansion head-on will benefit generations to come. As Congress begins to tackle infrastructure, I will work toward common-sense solutions to streamline the growth of hydropower projects that can help us achieve energy independence.
I applaud the #SupremeCourt for its decision today. This is a huge win for religious freedom.
‪Happy birthday, America! Today we celebrate all the brave men and women who have sacrificed so much for our freedom. #IndependenceDay ‬
Happy birthday, Mr. President!

Modernizing the TCPA is critical. Consumers and U.S. companies have taken the hit for far too long and it’s my job as Congressman to ensure that consumers and businesses are treated fairly. As a member of the Energy and Commerce Committee, I will continue working with my colleagues to make this a reality.

For far too long our military has used outdated equipment when facing 21st century threats. Our men and women in uniform deserve better. The NDAA will ensure that they have the financial resources to update equipment and are prepared to defend our nation.
I had a great time catching up with Greene County, Missouri Circuit Clerk Tom Barr this week in D.C. Southwest Missouri is lucky to have such a great guy willing to serve!

Today I voted in favor of providing for our military, securing the border, maintaining nuclear security and supporting the nation’s waterways infrastructure. The Make America Secure Appropriations Act will decrease our dependence on foreign oil, secure our Southern border and provide proper care for our veterans. It continues to build and strengthen our military while providing the largest pay increase for our troops in nearly a decade. This bill is critical for making sure our country remains safe and secure.

The deadline to apply for Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) and disaster assistance and low-interest disaster loans from the U.S. Small Business Administration (SBA) for Missouri homeowners, renters and businesses is Aug. 14, 2017. In late April, storms and flooding hit southwest Missouri causing damage to homes and businesses. With the help of Gov. Greitens, President Trump signed a disaster declaration, which allows federal assistance to be made available to those impacted.

Recently, we in Congress passed the Harry W. Colmery Veterans Educational Assistance Act of 2017, also known as the G.I. “forever” Bill, increasing the amount of benefits veterans receive under the post-9/11 G.I. Bill. Currently, veterans who receive G.I. Bill benefits have a 15-year time limit to use their benefits. This new bill would eliminate this time restriction and allow veterans to use these benefits at any point in their life. Other advantages include full benefits to Purple Heart recipients (regardless of their length of service), an increase in funding for veterans majoring in the science, technology, engineering and math fields and allow veterans to use their benefits for distance learning courses in technical and career education schools.

I look forward to having President Donald J. Trump in Springfield today to talk about the importance of tax reform and why we can't wait any longer. Our job in Washington isn’t to make Missourians’ lives harder, it’s to make them easier and to stay out of the way of the real job creators. Our broken tax code obviously does not accomplish that and needs to be improved.
Watch LIVE coverage of President Donald J. Trump's visit to Springfield here:

President Donald J. Trump gave an excellent speech today on tax reform. He's right. The American people are counting on us to deliver on tax reform and it's time we make good on that promise. I will continue to work with the president and my colleagues to pass comprehensive tax reform. It’s time to lower tax rates, get rid of all the bureaucratic red tape and give the American people and businesses a long overdue break. http://sgfnow.co/2wSNgnV

In the U.S. alone more than 80 percent of children diagnosed with cancer become long-term cancer survivors. I look forward to increasing that percentage by passing bills like the Childhood Cancer STAR Act. I will continue to work with my colleagues to ensure its passage in the House and the Senate and signed into law by the president.
We will never forget the lives lost on September 11, 2001, and the heroic actions of our first responders.
This is great news for southwest Missouri!

It’s time to lower tax rates, get rid of all the bureaucratic red tape and give the American people and businesses a long overdue break. It has been over 30 years since comprehensive tax reform has been passed. Today’s tax code is over 2 million words long and is so complicated that 90 percent of Americans either use software or hire professional accountants to do their taxes. That’s unacceptable and the American people deserve better. Click below to see how House Republicans plan to change that: goo.gl/BwjMhk

Today, the House passed H.R. 3354, the Make America Secure and Prosperous Appropriations Act, which includes my amendment that cuts through bureaucratic red tape and protects our farmers and ranchers. We need to prioritize our spending and put taxpayer’s dollars to good use. This bill does that by investing in policies and programs that protect the unborn, enforce our immigration policies and support our agriculture industry: http://bit.ly/2h43oMp

I enjoyed having Federal Communications Commission Chairman Ajit Pai in Ozark yesterday to talk about the importance of rural broadband. Internet access shouldn't be determined by geography. I will continue to be a strong advocate for underserved communities. With Missouri’s 7th Congressional District being predominantly rural, this issue hits home for me.

The Riverside Bridge project is one step closer to becoming a reality. The residents of Christian County have had to deal with the burdens of this broken bridge for several years due to flood damage, but federal restrictions on land adjacent to the bridge have prevented any solution. This bill eliminates those restrictions to clear the way for a new, safer Riverside Bridge that will again serve as an important artery connecting north and south Ozark.

I made a promise to cut spending, promote job creation and protect this country. Today I voted in favor of the FY18 budget. This bill will balance the budget within 10 years, prioritize regulation reform, pave the way for tax reform, limit the size of the federal government and strengthen our national defense. The status quo cannot continue, "Building a Better America" starts with fiscal responsibility.

REMINDER: Military Academy Nomination Applications are due Friday, October 13, at my Springfield office. If you have any questions, please visit my website at the link below or call 417-889-1800 with any questions.

I believe in an all-of-the-above energy approach but not at the expense of hardworking Americans. Today, President Trump made the right choice by rolling back the Obama-era Clean Power Plan. This is the right move for our economy; it will save consumers $33 billion by 2030. I'm proud to stand with the president in doing away with regulations that unnecessarily burden businesses.

Many rural areas throughout the country often experience a shortage of health professionals, and the result is that many who live in these underserved areas have to travel long distances to find a provider or simply go without care. The National Health Service Corps was created to address these provider shortages to encourage health care professionals, including primary care, dental and mental and behavioral health professionals, to work in underserved areas.

It has been over 30 years since we have had comprehensive tax reform. You shouldn’t need a PhD from MIT to do your taxes. Today, House Republicans made good on their promise and released a strong, pro-growth bill that makes the tax code simpler and fairer for all Americans. This bill will lead to better jobs, more take-home pay and a stronger economy. Missouri is home to over 500,000 small businesses that employ over 1.1 million workers. It’s time to give both the businesses and their employees a long overdue break.
Congratulations to the Monett High School men's swimming and diving team!

It was great talking with David Kurpius, dean of the Missouri School of Journalism, and Barbara Cochran today about the great work journalism students are doing at Mizzou and all around the world. There's a reason it's the No. 1 j-school in the world.
Thank you to all the brave men and women who have served this great nation to protect our freedoms. I can't thank you enough for your service and sacrifice. #VeteransDay
Great news from Ozarks Technical Community College! Thank you for helping our veterans.

It has been 31 years since the last true update. Our tax code has become too complex and contains too many opportunities for outcomes that defy common sense. We need reform that is simple, fair and easy. Today, the House took the first step and passed the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act, which lowers tax rates, expands standard deductions and closes special-interest loopholes. Hardworking Americans deserve a break and that is what we plan on giving them: a tax cut and a pay raise. After all, people know what to do with their money better than the government does.
Good luck today to Mt. Vernon, Carthage and Webb City! #MO07
Want to see the U.S. Capitol Christmas tree before it heads to DC? Stop by Bass Pro in Springfield on Tuesday, November 21, between 4:00 - 8:00 p.m.

Our nation is in a state of crisis. The opioid crisis plaguing our nation has claimed many lives. Its effects are felt in homes throughout the United States, and, for me, it’s an issue that hits close to home. I’ve said before, through the years I have had several close friends lose children to this epidemic. Over the last several years, the Energy and Commerce Committee, of which I am a member, has worked hard to find solutions and save lives.
Enjoyed writing holiday cards for our service members, veterans and their families. I can't thank these individuals enough for their service and sacrifice.

Hardworking Americans got an early Christmas present this year. The Tax Cuts and Jobs Act provides the first comprehensive reform of the tax code in over three decades. This legislation will help the American worker and ensure the continued vitality of the American economy. It lowers tax rates, closes loopholes and provides much-needed relief for families across the country. I look forward to watching the president sign this bill into law.
Merry Christmas from my family to yours! #MerryChristmas
